html:
The Power Grid Failed Again. Now What?

If you've spent the last year watching your family in Cuba navigate 12-hour blackouts with nothing but candles and a dying phone battery, you already know why you're here. Solar isn't a luxury anymore—it's the difference between your abuela having a working fan at night or suffering through another sweltering apagón. The good news? Prices have dropped. The tricky part? Picking panels that'll actually survive the humidity, ship without getting destroyed, and work with Cuba's electrical chaos. Let's figure this out together.

Here's what nobody tells you about sending solar panels to Cuba: wattage isn't everything. Sure, a 400W system sounds impressive, but if it weighs 80 pounds and your shipping agency charges by the pound, you've just spent more on freight than the panels themselves. And then there's the question of what your family actually needs—running a small refrigerator during outages is a different beast than keeping phones charged and a couple of LED lights on.

The panels I'm recommending here all share a few non-negotiables: monocrystalline cells (better efficiency in Cuba's intense sun), reasonable weight-to-wattage ratios, and included charge controllers so your family isn't hunting for parts in Havana. Some are rigid panels meant for permanent rooftop installation; others fold up and can be tucked away when the inspectors come around. Both have their place depending on your family's situation.

One more thing—voltage matters less than you'd think with solar. These panels output DC power that goes through a charge controller to batteries, so the 110V/220V debate doesn't apply here. What does matter is having a quality inverter on the Cuba side, but that's a separate purchase. Today, we're just getting sunlight into batteries.

The Quick Answer

For most families dealing with Cuban blackouts, the ECO-WORTHY 200W Kit hits the sweet spot—enough power to run essentials, includes everything needed to start, and the brand has a solid track record. If you can swing the shipping costs and your family has roof space, the 400W options give serious independence.

See the ECO-WORTHY 200W Kit →
Editor's Pick

ECO-WORTHY 200W Solar Panel Kit

4.6★ 465 reviews $$$$$

This is the one I'd send to my own family. Two 100W panels, a 30A PWM charge controller, and all the cables you need—nothing to hunt down in Cuba. Works with both 12V and 24V battery systems, which gives flexibility. The monocrystalline cells handle partial shade better than cheaper alternatives, and at 200W total, you're looking at enough juice to keep a small fridge running during daytime outages or charge multiple devices simultaneously.

VERDICT: The complete package. Best balance of power, price, and practicality for Cuban conditions.

Check Price on Amazon →
"400 watts sounds great until you realize it weighs as much as a small child and costs $200 to ship."

The Heavy Hitters: 400W Systems

If your family has roof space and you're committed to real energy independence, these 400W setups can run a refrigerator, multiple fans, and charge everything in the house. The catch? Weight and shipping costs. Calculate that before you commit.

Best Value 400W

400W Solar Panel 4-Pack (High-Output Design)

4.6★ $$$$$

Four 100W panels with high-efficiency cells. Works with 12V, 24V, or 48V systems—that 48V option is clutch if your family's setting up a serious battery bank. No controller included, so budget for that separately.

View on Amazon →

ECO-WORTHY 400W (4x 100W Panels)

4.5★ $$$$$

Same trusted ECO-WORTHY brand as our top pick, just doubled up. The listing says 2-pack but you get 4 panels total (confusing, I know). Solid aluminum frames that'll handle Cuba's salty coastal air better than plastic-backed alternatives.

View on Amazon →

How Much Solar Does Your Family Actually Need?

Plug in the typical blackout duration and see what these panels can realistically power. Spoiler: 100W keeps phones alive, 200W runs a fan, 400W starts to feel like civilization.

The Discreet Option: Foldable Panels

Not everyone can mount panels on their roof—whether it's a rental situation, nosy neighbors, or just wanting something that can be tucked away. These portable foldables are lighter, easier to ship, and can be set up in a window or balcony when needed.

Best Portable

BALDR 200W Foldable Solar Charger

4.4★ $$$$$

200 watts in a package that folds down to briefcase size. Designed for power stations and generators, so it'll work with whatever battery setup your family has. The monocrystalline cells are the same quality as rigid panels—you're just paying a premium for portability.

VERDICT: Maximum power in minimum space. Worth it if discretion matters.

Check Price →

DOKIO 150W Foldable

4.2★ $$$$

Only 7.3 lbs and folds to 21x20 inches. Includes its own controller and USB ports. The middle ground between the tiny 100W and the big 200W.

View on Amazon →

DOKIO 100W Portable Kit

4.2★ $$$

At 5.3 lbs, this is the lightest serious option. Dual USB ports for direct phone charging. Controller included. Best for apartments or backup use.

View on Amazon →

200W Showdown: Complete Kit vs. Panels Only

Both give you 200 watts. One includes everything; the other assumes you'll source the controller separately. Here's how they stack up:

Winner

ECO-WORTHY 200W Kit

  • ✓ 30A PWM controller included
  • ✓ All cables and connectors
  • ✓ 12V/24V compatible
  • ✓ 4.6★ rating
  • → Ready to install immediately

ECO-WORTHY 2x 100W Panels

  • ✓ Same quality panels
  • ✓ Marine/RV grade durability
  • ✗ No controller included
  • ✗ Need to source cables
  • → Only if you already have a controller

Starting Small: Budget-Friendly Options

Not everyone can drop $$$$$ on a full solar setup. These smaller options keep phones charged and LED lights running—sometimes that's enough to get through the night.

30W Foldable USB Panel

4.3★ $$

USB-C and USB-A ports, IP68 waterproof. Won't run a fridge, but keeps phones and small power banks topped up. Weighs almost nothing.

View →

Mini USB Solar Panels (2-pack)

4.1★ $$

Two 6W panels for the price of lunch. Charge a phone directly in sunlight. Great for security cameras or as a backup to your backup.

View →

Voltset 100W Complete Kit

4.5★ $$$$$

A proper 100W panel with 20A controller. Good starter system—run a fan during the day, charge batteries for night. Expandable later.

View →

More 100W Options Worth Considering

100W Kit with Z-Brackets & Cables

4.2★ $$$$

Includes 30A controller, 10AWG cables, and mounting brackets. The Z-brackets are actually useful—makes rooftop installation way easier. Solid complete package.

View on Amazon →

200W Kit (2x 100W) with 18BB Cells

4.2★ $$$$$

The "18BB" means 18 busbars—more connection points mean better performance in partial shade. Includes controller, Y-branch adapters, and Z-brackets. A+ grade cells.

View on Amazon →

100W Portable (IEC Certified)

3.6★ $$$$

23.5% efficiency and IP67 waterproof rating. The lower reviews concern me—some quality control issues reported. The IEC certification is nice, but I'd lean toward the DOKIO at this price point.

View on Amazon →

Calculate Your Shipping Costs

Solar panels are heavy. Before you commit, see what you're actually looking at for shipping to Cuba. Sometimes two 100W panels ship cheaper than one 200W unit.

Quick Reference: All Panels at a Glance

Panel Watts Type Controller Rating Price
ECO-WORTHY 200W Kit ⭐ 200W Rigid ✓ 30A 4.6★ $$$$$
400W 4-Pack (High-Output) 400W Rigid ✗ 4.6★ $$$$$
ECO-WORTHY 400W 400W Rigid ✗ 4.5★ $$$$$
BALDR 200W Foldable ⚡ 200W Foldable ✗ 4.4★ $$$$$
DOKIO 150W Foldable 150W Foldable ✓ 4.2★ $$$$
DOKIO 100W Portable 100W Foldable ✓ 4.2★ $$$
Voltset 100W Kit 100W Rigid ✓ 20A 4.5★ $$$$$
30W USB Foldable 30W Foldable N/A 4.3★ $$
Mini USB 2-Pack 12W Mini N/A 4.1★ $$

The Bottom Line

For most families in Cuba, the ECO-WORTHY 200W Kit is the move. It's got everything needed to start generating power immediately—no hunting for parts, no compatibility guessing. If you can handle the shipping weight and cost, jump to 400W for true energy independence. And if budget or discretion is the priority, the DOKIO foldables punch above their weight.

Whatever you choose, you're giving your family something priceless: light and connection when the grid fails. That's worth every dollar and every pound of shipping.

Get the ECO-WORTHY 200W Kit →

Your Solar Shipping Checklist
